about.body:
is an open space for exchange and learning. It emerged quite spontaneously when a few bitcoinerrak (Bitcoin enthusiasts) came together‚Äîmostly through that wonderful tool, Nostr‚Äîto stay connected, share knowledge and experiences, and learn from one another through studying and using different tools.

There‚Äôs no defined structure; we rely on staying connected with each other both online and through regular meetups. On the one hand, we share what each of us is working on and what topics we‚Äôd like to talk about. On the other hand, we hold group discussions during our meetups, sharing progress and diving into specific topics we've agreed on.

This ongoing contact enables cooperation and helps address needs within the group. Everyone contributes what they can, and in doing so, we gradually build an infrastructure that‚Äôs available to everyone.

signin.extensionHelp: Use a nostr extension to sign in.
signin.nostrConnectHelp: A NIP-46 remote signer allows you to keep your private key secured in a single location and remotely sign Nostr events. Create a token with full event permissions and then enter it below. You'll only have to do this once.
signin.noKeys: I don't have nostr keys yet
signin.signupHelp: Sign up with email on Flockstr

share.embedHelp: Copy the embed code which looks like nostr:nevent... or naddr...
share.njumpHelp: Share this link so your friend can open it in a nostr client of their choosing
share.pageHelp: Copy the link to this event on our website

mint.title: Mint
mint.tooltip: A mint is like a bank for ecash that offers instant and private transactions
mint.noDescription: The mint didn't provide a description.

nodes.tooltip: This is our node on the Lightning Network

apps.title: Apps
apps.tooltip: Check out all our self-hosted apps

relays.title: Relays
relays.tooltip: Did you know that much of this website lives on nostr? A relay is where data is stored in the nostr protocol

onboardingBitcoin.title: Starting with Bitcoin
onboardingBitcoin.description: At Bitcoin Txoko we believe that the best way to learn about bitcoin is to use it, spend it and better yet, earn it. It only takes 10 minutes to set up a wallet and a store to start transacting on the Lightning Network with Bitcoin Txoko.
onboardingBitcoin.walletDescription: A Lightning wallet allows you to make instant Bitcoin transactions with low fees. Bitcoin Txoko offers a Lightning wallet for free. It also integrates with the BTCPay server store when you want to set one up later. Note that custodial means that Bitcoin Txoko is in custody of your funds. When you are ready to take on self-custody, you can switch to a self-custodial wallet like Phoenix.
onboardingBitcoin.boltcardDescription: A BoltCard is like a debit card for the Lightning Network. You can reload it with funds and spend by tapping the card on NFC readers. Once you have set up a Lightning wallet with LNbits in the previous step, it only takes a few minutes to create a BoltCard. You can purchase an NFC card from our store. See our setup guide on how to set it up.
onboardingBitcoin.shopDescription: With BTCPay server you can create a store to start selling your goods and services for Bitcoin, whether you want to create a Point of Sale or an online store. You can connect your existing wallet to receive transactions in Lightning. You can also link an on-chain wallet for larger transactions. It only takes a few minutes to set up. See our guide for more details.
